repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/35485.

Allow users to customize how inline completion items should be accepted.

I've done some renaming so that it should be more suitable for the exposed API.

comment_data.body: Could you elaborate on what the default handler does?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2259,6 +2269,9 @@ get({opts})                                  *vim.lsp.inline_completion.get()*
       • {opts}  (`table?`) A table with the following fields:
                 • {bufnr}? (`integer`, default: 0) Buffer handle, or 0 for
                   current.
+                • {on_accept}? (`fun(item: vim.lsp.inline_completion.Item)`)
+                  Accept handler, called with the accepted item. If not
+                  provided, the default handler is used.

comment_data.body: Why change the verb from "apply" to "accept"?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2240,9 +2250,9 @@ enable({enable}, {filter})                *vim.lsp.inline_completion.enable()*
                     for all.
 
 get({opts})                                  *vim.lsp.inline_completion.get()*
-    Apply the currently displayed completion candidate to the buffer.
+    Accept the currently displayed completion candidate to the buffer.

comment_data.body: The custom method for GitHub Copilot to partially accept is called textDocument/didPartialAccept, in case it gets upstreamed in the future, to avoid having two different terms for the same thing.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2240,9 +2250,9 @@ enable({enable}, {filter})                *vim.lsp.inline_completion.enable()*
                     for all.
 
 get({opts})                                  *vim.lsp.inline_completion.get()*
-    Apply the currently displayed completion candidate to the buffer.
+    Accept the currently displayed completion candidate to the buffer.

comment_data.body: `vim.wait()` takes a callback so it can check `result` every few ms. Would that avoid the hardcoded 100 ms wait, and a potentially flaky test?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -183,6 +184,57 @@ describe('vim.lsp.inline_completion', function()
       feed('<Esc>')
       screen:expect({ grid = grid_applied_candidates })
     end)
+
+    it('accepts on_accept callback', function()
+      feed('i')
+      screen:expect({ grid = grid_with_candidates })
+      local result = exec_lua(function()
+        ---@type vim.lsp.inline_completion.Item
+        local result
+        vim.lsp.inline_completion.get({
+          on_accept = function(item)
+            result = item
+          end,
+        })
+        vim.wait(100) -- Wait for async callback

comment_data.body: Since the entire inline completion feature is new itself I would leave out this entry.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -236,6 +236,7 @@ LSP
 • |vim.lsp.buf.signature_help()| supports "noActiveParameterSupport".
 • Support for `textDocument/inlineCompletion` |lsp-inline_completion|
   https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.18/specification/#textDocument_inlineCompletion
+• |vim.lsp.inline_completion.get()| now accepts a `on_accept` callback.

comment_data.body: Or we can use the `retry` utility: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a33284c2c068a9204330bc941e274b1f5bd9f5c6/test/testutil.lua#L75
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -183,6 +184,57 @@ describe('vim.lsp.inline_completion', function()
       feed('<Esc>')
       screen:expect({ grid = grid_applied_candidates })
     end)
+
+    it('accepts on_accept callback', function()
+      feed('i')
+      screen:expect({ grid = grid_with_candidates })
+      local result = exec_lua(function()
+        ---@type vim.lsp.inline_completion.Item
+        local result
+        vim.lsp.inline_completion.get({
+          on_accept = function(item)
+            result = item
+          end,
+        })
+        vim.wait(100) -- Wait for async callback

comment_data.body: That might be awkward inside of `n.exec_lua`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -183,6 +184,57 @@ describe('vim.lsp.inline_completion', function()
       feed('<Esc>')
       screen:expect({ grid = grid_applied_candidates })
     end)
+
+    it('accepts on_accept callback', function()
+      feed('i')
+      screen:expect({ grid = grid_with_candidates })
+      local result = exec_lua(function()
+        ---@type vim.lsp.inline_completion.Item
+        local result
+        vim.lsp.inline_completion.get({
+          on_accept = function(item)
+            result = item
+          end,
+        })
+        vim.wait(100) -- Wait for async callback

comment_regular_data.body: The CI failed because it's a `feat` PR without updating news.txt. Should I change the commit message to `refactor`?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): expose `vim.lsp.inline_completion.get.Opts.on_accept`
